official-title.#text:
To provide certain uninsured individuals a special enrollment period after tax filing in 2015 for
			 enrollment in qualified health plans offered through an Exchange, and for
			 other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Get Your Refund, Get Your Health Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Get Your Refund, Get Your Health Care Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Special enrollment period for certain uninsured individuals after tax filing period in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall require that Exchanges established under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Health and Human Services

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
provide to qualified uninsured individuals a 60-day special enrollment
			 period that begins on April 15, 2015 (or, if earlier, on the date such
			 individual files an income tax return applicable to the first taxable year
			 beginning on or after January 1, 2014).

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
title I
			 of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/t:I

text.#text:
is eligible, but who has not elected, to enroll in a qualified health plan offered through an
			 Exchange established under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
during the open enrollment period
			 for 2015; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
title I of the Patient Protection and
			 Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/t:I

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
with respect to
			 any month in 2014.

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

text.#text: is liable for a penalty under

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 5147 IH: Get Your Refund, Get Your Health Care Act
